table.name: mem
table.column: Both {'ab:v:nolink} and {'aD:v} mean "have a length of", but they are used in different contexts. {'ab:v:nolink} is used for long items and to express height. The object of {'ab:v:nolink} is the length or height of the subject.

Sowohl {'ab:v:nolink} als auch {'aD:v} bedeuten "haben eine Länge von", werden jedoch in unterschiedlichen Kontexten verwendet. {'ab:v:nolink} wird für lange Gegenstände und zum Ausdrücken der Höhe verwendet. Das Objekt von {'ab:v:nolink} ist die Länge oder Höhe des Subjekts. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

هر دو {'ab:v:nolink} و {'aD:v} به معنای "طول" دارند ، اما در متن های مختلف استفاده می شوند. {'ab:v:nolink} برای موارد طولانی و بیان قد استفاده می شود. هدف {'ab:v:nolink} طول یا ارتفاع موضوع است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Tanto {'ab:v:nolink} quanto {'aD:v} significam "tamanho", mas são usados ​​em contextos diferentes. {'ab:v:nolink} é usado para itens longos e para expressar altura. O objeto de {'ab:v:nolink} é o comprimento ou a altura do assunto. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

In anatomy, abduction refers to moving away from a midline. In particular, abduction at the shoulder means raising the arms up, an action which is often done to measure the length of something. Its counterpart, adduction, refers to movement towards a midline.

▶ {wej 'ujmey 'ab 'oy'naQ.:sen:nolink} "Painstiks are a little over one meter long."[1] ▶ {jav 'ujmey 'ab SuvwI'.:sen:nolink} "The warrior is six ujs tall." (about 6'10")[2] ▶ {vagh 'ujmey vI'ab.:sen:nolink} "I'm five ujs tall." (about 5'8")[2] ▶ {wej 'uj 'ab naQjej.:sen:nolink} "the spear is three uj long" (about 3'5")[2] ▶ {loSmaH jav vI' Soch loS 'uj 'ab meH:sen:nolink} "Bridge Height: 16.28 M"[3] ▶ {HIvtaHvIS toQDuj cha'vatlh wejmaH Soch vI' vagh chorgh 'uj 'ab 'oH:sen:nolink} "Attack Formation Height: 82.75 M"[3] ▶ {qughtaHvIS toQDuj HutmaH vI' jav wa' 'uj 'ab 'oH:sen:nolink} "Cruise Formation Height: 31.56 M"[3] ▶ {SaqtaHvIS toQDuj wa'vatlh loS vI' jav chorgh 'uj 'ab 'oH:sen:nolink} "Landing Formation Height: 36.46 M"[3]
length, height, long, high, have a length of, have a height of

table.name: mem
table.column: but, nevertheless, even so, however, whereas
اما، با این حال، حتی در همین حال، در حالی که [AUTOTRANSLATED]
men, ändå, dock, trots allt, emellertid
但是、儘管如此、然而、儘管如此 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
mas, no entanto, mesmo assim, enquanto
این گاهی اوقات به {'a:conj:nolink} کوتاه می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Às vezes, isso é encurtado para {'a:conj:nolink}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was defined as "but, nevertheless, even so, however" in {TKD:src}. The definition "whereas" for expressing contrast was added at {qep'a' 25 (2018):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The Beatles song "Tomorrow Never Knows" contains the lyric "surrender to the void" ({jegh:v} "surrender" + {cha':n:num} "two").
The example which came with the request is about outer space, so this seems to be a scientific term rather than a philosophical term.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was originally defined as "vein" in {TKD:src}, and subsequently expanded to mean "blood vessel" in general.

table.name: mem
table.column: Both {'aD:v:nolink} and {'ab:v} mean "have a length of", but they are used slightly differently. For flat objects such as tabletops, {'aD:v:nolink} is used for one dimension while {juch:v} is used for the other. For long objects, and for height, {'ab:v:nolink} is used instead.[2]

هر دو {'aD:v:nolink} و {'ab:v} به معنی "دارای طول" هستند ، اما از آنها کمی متفاوت استفاده می شود. در مورد اشیاء مسطح مانند تبلت ، {'aD:v:nolink} برای یک بعد استفاده می شود ، در حالی که {juch:v} برای دیگری استفاده می شود. در عوض برای اشیاء طولانی و از ارتفاع ، به جای آن از {'ab:v:nolink} استفاده می شود.[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Både {'aD:v:nolink} och {'ab:v} betyder "har en längd på", men de används något annorlunda. För platta objekt som bordsskivor används {'aD:v:nolink} för en dimension medan {juch:v} används för den andra. För långa föremål och för höjd används istället {'ab:v:nolink}.[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Как {'aD:v:nolink}, так и {'ab:v} означают «иметь длину», но они используются немного по-разному. Для плоских объектов, таких как столешницы, {'aD:v:nolink} используется для одного измерения, а {juch:v} - для другого. Для длинных объектов и для высоты вместо этого используется {'ab:v:nolink}.[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
{'aD:v:nolink}和{'ab:v}均表示“長度為”，但用法略有不同。對於諸如桌面之類的扁平物體，{'aD:v:nolink}用於一個尺寸，而{juch:v}用於另一尺寸。對於長物體和高度，將使用{'ab:v:nolink}代替。[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

In anatomy, abduction refers to moving away from a midline. In particular, abduction at the shoulder means raising the arms up, an action which is often done to measure the length of something. Its counterpart, adduction, refers to movement towards a midline.
▶ {wejvatlh loSmaH loS vI' vagh wej 'uj 'aD Duj:sen:nolink} "Length: 120 M"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: The English translation of the sentence from {Star Trek Constellations:src} does not appear in the book, but in the author's annotations which was a separate document.

table.name: mem
table.column: Detta är den första rankingen av {yaS:n}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also used for random numbers, such as when throwing dice ({mI' nagh:n}). See {'al:v:2}.
Dies wird auch für Zufallszahlen verwendet, z. B. beim Würfeln ({mI' nagh:n}). Siehe {'al:v:2}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این همچنین برای اعداد تصادفی ، مانند هنگام پرتاب تاس ({mI' nagh:n}) استفاده می شود. به {'al:v:2} مراجعه کنید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這也用於隨機數，例如擲骰子（{mI' nagh:n}）時。參見{'al:v:2}。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso também é usado para números aleatórios, como ao jogar dados ({mI' nagh:n}). Consulte {'al:v:2}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Muhammad Ali said to "float like a butterfly and sting like a bee".

The fact that this can be used adjectivally for numbers[2] suggests that it is a stative verb, but it is not out of the question that maybe it can be used adjectivally only for numbers but can take an object otherwise.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is just the verb {'al:v:1} applied to numbers.
Dies ist nur das Verb {'al:v:1}, das auf Zahlen angewendet wird. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این فقط فعل {'al:v:1} است که به اعداد اعمال می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är bara verbet {'al:v:1} som tillämpas på siffror. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это просто глагол {'al:v:1}, применяемый к числам. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這只是應用於數字的動詞{'al:v:1}。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é apenas o verbo {'al:v:1} aplicado aos números. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Based on the explanation and the examples, this is a stative verb. However, the definition of {'al:v:1:nolink} as "float (in/on air)" rather than "be floating" leaves open the possibility that it can take an object in other contexts.

table.name: mem
table.column: Alnilam is the star in the middle of Orion's belt.

table.name: mem
table.column: The request was "freckle(s)" so this is how it may appear in other word lists, but the "(s)" has been removed here for consistency with other definitions.

table.name: mem
table.column: yxa med med spets i änden

table.name: mem
table.column:
The definition is given as "glass", in a list of materials.
"Aluminium oxynitride" is the ceramic known as "transparent aluminum".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a specialized school.[2] (For the most general word for a place of learning, see {DuSaQ:n}.)
Dies ist eine spezialisierte Schule.[2] (Das allgemeinste Wort für einen Lernort finden Sie unter {DuSaQ:n}.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en specialskola.[2] (För {DuSaQ:n} för det mest allmänna ordet för en plats för lärande). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это специализированная школа.[2] (наиболее общее слово для места обучения см. {DuSaQ:n}.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é uma escola especializada.[2] (Para a palavra mais genérica para um local de aprendizado, consulte {DuSaQ:n}.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is a reference to the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS).

table.name: mem
table.column: Irma was the main character of the 1957 play "The Balcony".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This can be used for when someone sacrifices forces for a certain goal or just wastes their resources.[1]
Most Klingon lexicographers consider this and {'an:v:2} to be two homophonous words, but historically, the "be a waste" meaning developed out of the "be petrified" meaning, perhaps because something loses any original use it may have had if it is turned to stone.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used to talk about fossils. Most Klingon lexicographers consider this and {'an:v:1} to be two homophonous words, but historically, the "be a waste" meaning developed out of the "be petrified" meaning, perhaps because something loses any original use it may have had if it is turned to stone.
When applied to people, it can only mean literal turning to stone. (It does not mean "really scared" as "petrified" does in English.)

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Federation. Also called {'anDorya':n:nolink}. Not to be confused with the country on Earth called {'anDo'ra':n}.
Ein Planet in der Föderation. Wird auch als {'anDorya':n:nolink} bezeichnet. Nicht zu verwechseln mit dem Land auf der Erde namens {'anDo'ra':n}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Планета в Федерации. Также называется {'anDorya':n:nolink}. Не путать со страной на Земле под названием {'anDo'ra':n}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
聯邦中的一顆行星。也稱為{'anDorya':n:nolink}。不要與地球上叫做{'anDo'ra':n}的國家相混淆。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has not explicitly appeared in canon, but is implied to exist by {'anDor:n} and {'anDorya'ngan:n}, and the variations in planet names described in {KGT p.141-142:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a chemical compound which reacts to create an explosion when combined with {yuryum:n}.
Dies ist eine chemische Verbindung, die in Kombination mit {yuryum:n} zu einer Explosion reagiert. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک ترکیب شیمیایی است که هنگام ایجاد ترکیب با {yuryum:n} واکنش نشان می دهد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en kemisk förening som reagerar för att skapa en explosion när den kombineras med {yuryum:n}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это химическое соединение, которое в сочетании с {yuryum:n} реагирует на взрыв. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一種化學物質，與{yuryum:n}結合時會發生爆炸。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um composto químico que reage para criar uma explosão quando combinado com {yuryum:n}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a name from {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}'s play {'antonI' tlhI'yopatra' je:sen:nolink}.
Dies ist ein Name aus {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}s Spiel {'antonI' tlhI'yopatra' je:sen:nolink}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是{wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}的戲劇{'antonI' tlhI'yopatra' je:sen:nolink}的名字。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um nome da peça de {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name} de {'antonI' tlhI'yopatra' je:sen:nolink}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran vegetable.
Dies ist, was Klingonen das terranische Gemüse nennen würden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها آن را سبزیجات Terran می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det här är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terran-grönsaken. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что клингоны назвали бы терранским овощем. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是克林崗人所說的人族蔬菜。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é o que os klingons chamariam de vegetal terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The same word is used for fossils of plants, bones, etc.
Das gleiche Wort wird für Fossilien von Pflanzen, Knochen usw. verwendet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
همین کلمه برای فسیل های گیاهان ، استخوان ها و غیره استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Samma ord används för fossil av växter, ben osv. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это же слово используется для окаменелостей растений, костей и т. Д. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
同一詞用於植物，骨骼等的化石。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A mesma palavra é usada para fósseis de plantas, ossos, etc. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Rhona Fenwick is a Klingon speaker who is an archeologist.

table.name: mem
table.column: نشان می دهد، نشان می دهد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {qablIj HI'ang:sen:nolink} "Show me your face!" (see {Hay':v})[2, p.68] ▶ {ro'lIj HI'ang!:sen}[2, p.195]

table.name: mem
table.column: 'ang'eghQo' quv Hutlhbogh jagh neH ghobtaHvIS ghaH.
Only an enemy without honor refuses to show himself in battle.
Nur ein Gegner ohne Ehre zeigt sein Gesicht nicht während des Kampfes.
تنها یک دشمن بدون احترام حاضر به نشان دادن خود در نبرد نیست. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Endast en fiende utan ära vägrar att visa sig i strid. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Только враг без чести отказывается показывать себя в бою. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
只有沒有榮譽的敵人才會拒絕在戰鬥中展示自己。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Apenas um inimigo sem honra recusa se mostrar em batalha.
Only an enemy without honour refuses to show himself in battle.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Latin word for eel is "anguilla".

table.name: mem
table.column: Arthur Philip Dent is the protagonist of {The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the general term for a small container.[3]
Dies ist der allgemeine Begriff für einen kleinen Behälter.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح عمومی برای یک ظرف کوچک است.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är den allmänna termen för en liten behållare.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это общий термин для небольшого контейнера.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一個小容器的總稱。[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o termo geral para um pequeno recipiente.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This word was originally used to translated "Limited Edition" for {Klingon Monopoly:src}, as {'aplo'mey puS neH chenmoHlu'pu':sen:nolink}, before {'aplo':n:nolink} was changed to {vey:n}. The Klingon version of the list of the game box's "contents" also has the heading {ngaS 'aplo':sen:nolink}. (There is a typo in {ngaS 'aplo':sen:nolink}: it actually reads {naS 'aplo':sen:nolink} on the box, but it's clear what was meant.)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the metallic chemical element with the symbol Ca and atomic number 20.
Dies ist das metallische chemische Element mit dem Symbol Ca und der Ordnungszahl 20. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این عنصر شیمیایی فلزی با نماد Ca و عدد اتمی 20 است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är det metalliska kemiska elementet med symbolen Ca och atomnummer 20. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это металлический химический элемент с символом Ca и атомным номером 20. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是金屬化學元素，符號為Ca，原子序數為20。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o elemento químico metálico com o símbolo Ca e o número atômico 20. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: um pássaro parecido com um falcão
This is a particular kind of {toQ:n} which flies particularly fast.
Dies ist eine besondere Art von {toQ:n}, die besonders schnell fliegt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نوع خاصی از {toQ:n} است که به سرعت سریع پرواز می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en viss typ av {toQ:n} som flyger särskilt snabbt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это особый вид {toQ:n}, который летит особенно быстро. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um tipo particular de {toQ:n} que voa particularmente rápido. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Apus" is the Latin name for the birds commonly known as swifts.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to predicting based on deductive reasoning or research or science.
Note that weather forecasts (see {muD Dotlh:n}) tend to use {'e' -lu:sen@@'e':n, -lu':v} over {net:n}, but using {net:n:nolink} would not be wrong.

Dies bezieht sich auf eine Vorhersage, die auf wissenschaftliche Erkenntnisse basiert.
Man beachte dass es bei der Wettervorhersage (siehe {muD Dotlh:n}) üblich ist {'e' -lu:sen@@'e':n, -lu':v} anstatt {net:n} zu sagen, aber {net:n:nolink} zu verwenden wäre nicht falsch.
The word for "reason" or "intellect" in Arabic is "'aql".

▶ {SIS 'e' vI'aq:sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, vI-:v, 'aq:v} "I forecast/predict (that it will) rain." ▶ {SIS 'e' 'aqlu':sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v} "it is predicted that it will rain" ▶ {SIS 'e' 'aqlu'bej:sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v, -bej:v} "it is predicted with certainty that it will rain" ▶ {SISbe' 'e' 'aqlu'bej:sen@@SIS:v, -be':v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v, -bej:v} "it is predicted with certainty that it will not rain" ▶ {SIS 'e' 'aqlu'law':sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v, -law':v} "it would appear that it will rain, it seems that it will rain" ▶ {ghaytan SIS 'e' 'aqlu':sen@@ghaytan:adv, SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v} "it's likely that it will rain" ▶ {SIS 'e' 'aqlu', javmaH vatlhvI' DIch:sen@@SIS:v, 'e':n, 'aq:v, -lu':v, jav:n:1,num, maH:n:2,num, vatlhvI':n, DIch:n} "it is predicted that it will rain, 60% certainty", or "there's a 60% chance it will rain"

table.name: mem
table.column: type of weapon (half ax, half bat'leth)
ett slags vapen (hälften yxa, hälften bat'leth)
type of weapon (half ax, half bat'leth) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tipo de arma (meio machado, meio bat'leth)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a general purpose knife that seems to be able to cut through anything.
Dies ist ein Allzweckmesser, das anscheinend alles durchschneiden kann. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک چاقوی عمومی است که به نظر می رسد می تواند هر چیزی را از بین ببرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en kniv med allmänna ändamål som verkar kunna klippa igenom vad som helst. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это нож общего назначения, который, кажется, способен прорезать что угодно. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一把通用刀具，似乎可以切穿任何東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é uma faca de uso geral que parece capaz de cortar qualquer coisa. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The phrase "Act now!" is used repeatedly in TV informercials for Ginsu knives.

table.name: mem
table.column: bottom surface of a table, ceiling
bottom surface of a table, ceiling [AUTOTRANSLATED]
superfície inferior de uma mesa, teto
The other face of an object's {'aqroS:n:1,nolink} is its {yor:n}.[1]
Die andere Seite von {'aqroS:n:1,nolink} eines Objekts ist {yor:n}.[1] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det andra ansiktet på ett objekts {'aqroS:n:1,nolink} är dess {yor:n}.[1] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A outra face do {'aqroS:n:1,nolink} de um objeto é o seu {yor:n}.[1] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is used to specify a limit or restriction.
In other contexts, consider using the verb suffix {-qu':v}. For example: {nom yIghoSqu'!:sen}
▶ {'aqroS qughDo:sen:nolink}: {pIvlob Hut vI' vagh:sen:nolink} "Maximum Cruising Speed - Warp 9.5"[1] ▶ {Qapchu'meH 'aqroS chuq:n:nolink} "maximum effective range"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: A character in a famous Klingon opera.
Eine Figur in einer berühmten klingonischen Oper. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
شخصیتی در یک اپرای معروف کلینگون. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En karaktär i en berömd Klingon-opera. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
著名的克林崗歌劇中的角色。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um personagem de uma famosa ópera Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the trailing or climbing plant itself.
Dies bezieht sich auf die Schlepp- oder Kletterpflanze selbst. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مربوط به خود گیاه کوهنوردی یا کوهنوردی است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser släp- eller klättringsanläggningen själv. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к самому висячему или вьющемуся растению. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指拖尾植物或攀援植物本身。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se à planta de reboque ou trepadeira em si. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

"Luffa acutangula" is a type of gourd known as vegetable gourd or Chinese okra. In the episode {TOS - The Apple:src}, a character named Akuta smashes a Persian melon.
The request was for the plant. Presumably, the fruit be {'aquta' naH:n@@'aquta':n, naH:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: act of watching over a fallen warrior's body
Betrachten des Körpers eines gefallen Kriegers
عمل تماشای یک بدن جنگجو افتاده [AUTOTRANSLATED]
agera att titta över en fallen krigare kropp [AUTOTRANSLATED]
акт наблюдения за телом павшего воина [AUTOTRANSLATED]
看著墮落的戰士身體的行為 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ato de vigiar o corpo de um guerreiro caído

This is an ancient tradition where the comrades of a warrior who had died in battle stayed with the body to keep away predators, which allowed the spirit ({qa':n}) to leave the body when it was ready for the journey to Sto-Vo-Kor ({Suto'vo'qor:n}).

Dies ist eine alte Tradition, in der die Kameraden eines Kriegers, der im Kampf gestorben war, beim Körper blieben, um Raubtiere fernzuhalten, wodurch der Geist ({qa':n}) den Körper verlassen konnte, als er für die Reise nach Sto-Vo-Kor bereit war ( {Suto'vo'qor:n}). [AUTOTRANSLATED]

این یک سنت باستانی است که در آن رفقای یک رزمنده که در نبرد جان باخته بود ، در کنار بدن قرار گرفتند تا شکارچیان را دور نگه دارند ، که این امر به روح ({qa':n}) اجازه می داد هنگام آماده شدن برای سفر به استو وو-کور ، بدن را ترک کند. {Suto'vo'qor:n}). [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Detta är en gammal tradition där kamraterna till en krigare som hade dött i striden stannade med kroppen för att hålla undan rovdjur, vilket gjorde det möjligt för andan ({qa':n}) att lämna kroppen när den var redo för resan till Sto-Vo-Kor ( {Suto'vo'qor:n}). [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Это древняя традиция, когда товарищи воина, погибшего в бою, оставались с телом, чтобы удерживать хищников, что позволило духу ({qa':n}) покинуть тело, когда оно было готово к путешествию в Сто-Во-Кор ( {Suto'vo'qor:n}). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一種古老的傳統，在戰鬥中喪生的戰士的同志們與屍體呆在一起，以遠離掠食者，這使得靈魂（{qa':n}）在準備前往Sto-Vo-Kor的旅程中離開了屍體（ {Suto'vo'qor:n}）。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This question word follows the noun to which it refers, which never has a plural suffix.[1]
Grammatically, a plural prefix is used if the questioned noun can be singular or plural and the translation is "how many?" A singular prefix is used if the questioned noun is something that can't be counted and the translation is "how much?"[2]

▶ {Haw'pu' yaS 'ar?:sen:nolink} "How many officers fled?" ({TKD p.70:src}) ▶ {nIn 'ar wIghaj?:sen:nolink} "How much fuel do we have?" ({TKD p.70,170:src}) ▶ {Dochvetlh DIlmeH Huch 'ar DaneH?:sen} "How much do you want for that?" ({TKD p.171:src}) ▶ {Duj 'ar DIlegh?:sen:nolink} "How many ships do we see?"[2] ▶ {bIQ 'ar wIlegh?:sen:nolink} "How much water do we see?"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The ivy belongs to the genus "Hedera".

table.name: mem
table.column: "Argh!" One might say this when one's writer's cramp worsens.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the most common of several ways of asking for the time in Klingon. One can also ask, {'arlogh wab Qoylu'pu'?:sen:nolink} or {qen 'arlogh Qoylu'pu'?:sen:nolink} The answer to this question is, for example, {cha'logh Qoylu'pu':sen:nolink} "It has been heard twice", meaning "two o'clock".
The Federation's 24-hour system ({tera' poH:n}) is sometimes used in interplanetary communication. When working within this system, the way to ask for the time is to issue the command, {rep yIper!:sen:nolink} In replying to this command, the hours are not counted, but rather numbered from 1 to 24. For example, {tera' rep cha':sen:nolink} or {rep cha':sen:nolink} is "two o'clock". When context is clear, {tera':n} may be left out.
▶ {mamejDI' 'arlogh Qoylu'pu'?:sen@@ma-:v, mej:v, -DI':v, 'arlogh Qoylu'pu'?:sen} "What time do we leave?"

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to inheritance in the sense that if a father dies, his son inherits his possessions.
Dies bezieht sich auf das Erbe in dem Sinne, dass wenn ein Vater stirbt, sein Sohn seinen Besitz erbt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به ارث اشاره دارد به این معنا که اگر پدری بمیرد ، پسرش اموال خود را به ارث می برد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänvisar till arv i den meningen att om en far dör, arver hans son sina ägodelar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к наследованию в том смысле, что, если отец умирает, его сын наследует его имущество. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指繼承，即父親去世，兒子繼承其財產。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere à herança no sentido de que, se um pai morre, seu filho herda seus bens. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is typically found on the feet of some sort of Klingon animal or on Klingon trees. In non-scientific, everyday speech, this seems to function as a general term for "fungus".[2]

Dies ist normalerweise an den Füßen eines klingonischen Tieres oder an klingonischen Bäumen zu finden. In der nichtwissenschaftlichen Alltagssprache scheint dies als allgemeiner Begriff für "Pilz" zu fungieren.[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به طور معمول در پای نوعی از حیوانات کلینگون یا درختان کلینگون یافت می شود. در گفتار روزمره غیر علمی ، به نظر می رسد که این به عنوان یک اصطلاح کلی برای "قارچ" عمل می کند.[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta finns vanligtvis på fötter på ett slags Klingon-djur eller på Klingon-träd. I icke-vetenskapliga vardagliga tal verkar detta fungera som en allmän term för "svamp".[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Обычно это встречается на ногах какого-то клингонского животного или на клингонских деревьях. В ненаучной повседневной речи это, по-видимому, служит общим термином «гриб».[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這通常在某種克林貢動物的腳上或克林貢樹上發現。在非科學的日常用語中，這似乎是“真菌”的總稱。[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Isso geralmente é encontrado nos pés de algum tipo de animal Klingon ou em árvores Klingon. No discurso cotidiano não científico, isso parece funcionar como um termo geral para "fungo".[2] [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: این به معنای واقعی کلمه به معنای "قارچ نرم" است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: When an escaped prisoner looks for a guard, he always finds one.
Ein entflohener Gefangener, der nach einem Wächter sucht, wird immer einen finden.
هنگامی که یک زندانی فراری به دنبال یک نگهبان است، او همیشه یکی را پیدا می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
När en flyktig fångare letar efter en vakt finner han alltid en. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Когда сбежавший заключенный ищет охранника, он всегда находит его. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
當逃脫的囚犯尋找警衛時，他總能找到一個。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Quando um prisioneiro escapado procura um guarda, ele sempre encontra um.

table.name: mem
table.column: A prisoner says to the guard...
یک زندانی به محافظ می گوید ... [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to passing through matter, as ghosts, phased lifeforms, or particles may do.
Dies bezieht sich auf das Durchlaufen von Materie, wie es Geister, phasenweise Lebensformen oder Partikel tun können. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به معنای گذر از ماده است ، همانطور که ارواح ، شکل های مرحله زندگی یا ذرات ممکن است انجام دهند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänför sig till att passera genom materien, som spöken, fasformade livsformer eller partiklar kan göra. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к прохождению через материю, как это могут делать призраки, фазированные формы жизни или частицы. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指穿過物質，就像鬼影，分階段的生命形式或粒子可能發生的那樣。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere à passagem pela matéria, como fantasmas, formas de vida em fases ou partículas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a type of beverage made from (among other things) the {melchoQ:n} of a {teghbat:n}. It has a superficial resemblance to Terran root beer.[1, p.95]
This word refers not to a specific drink, but to a narrow class of related drinks.[2]
"A&W" is a brand of root beer.

table.name: mem
table.column:
"Ow".
The example literally means "My eyes sting me", which shows that {'aw':v:nolink} can take an object.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to float in/on water or other liquids. For something floating freely in space, see {rIjHa':v}.
Dies bedeutet, in / auf Wasser oder anderen Flüssigkeiten zu schwimmen. Informationen zu etwas, das frei im Raum schwebt, finden Sie unter {rIjHa':v}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به معنی شناور شدن در / روی آب یا مایعات دیگر است. برای چیزی که آزادانه در فضا شناور است ، به {rIjHa':v} مراجعه کنید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta betyder att flyta i / på vatten eller andra vätskor. För {rIjHa':v} för något som flyter fritt i rymden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это означает плавать в / на воде или других жидкостях. Что-то свободно плавающее в космосе, смотрите {rIjHa':v}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這意味著要漂浮在水或其他液體中/上面。有關可在太空中自由漂浮的東西，請參閱{rIjHa':v}。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso significa flutuar na água ou em outros líquidos. Para algo flutuando livremente no espaço, consulte {rIjHa':v}. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Floaters are found in the vitreous of the eye.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used for any kind of building element, construction part, or even Lego pieces.[3]
Dies kann für jede Art von Bauelement, Bauteil oder sogar Lego-Teilen verwendet werden.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این می تواند برای هر نوع عنصر ساختمان ، قسمت ساخت و ساز یا حتی قطعات لگو استفاده شود.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta kan användas för alla typer av byggnadselement, konstruktionsdelar eller till och med Lego-bitar.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это может быть использовано для любого вида строительных элементов, строительных деталей или даже деталей Lego.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
它可以用於任何類型的建築元素，建築零件，甚至是樂高積木。[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso pode ser usado para qualquer tipo de elemento de construção, peça de construção ou mesmo peças de Lego.[3] [AUTOTRANSLATED]
